trans-unit.source: Allows the application to access the window menu for copying and modifying

seg-source.mrk: Allows the application to access the window menu for copying and modifying

target.mrk: Allows the application to access the window menu for copying and modifying

trans-unit.source: Handle to the window that will own a copy of the window menu

seg-source.mrk: Handle to the window that will own a copy of the window menu

target.mrk: Handle to the window that will own a copy of the window menu

trans-unit.source: [optional] Specifies the action to be taken. If this parameter is False, the function returns a handle to the copy of the window menu currently in use. The copy is initially identical to the window menu, but it can be modified.

seg-source.mrk: Specifies the action to be taken.
If this parameter is False, the function returns a handle to the copy of the window menu currently in use.
The copy is initially identical to the window menu, but it can be modified.

target.mrk: Specifies the action to be taken.
If this parameter is False, the function returns a handle to the copy of the window menu currently in use.
The copy is initially identical to the window menu, but it can be modified.

trans-unit.source: If this parameter is True, the function resets the window menu back to the default state. The previous window menu, if any, is destroyed.

seg-source.mrk: If this parameter is True, the function resets the window menu back to the default state.
The previous window menu, if any, is destroyed.

target.mrk: If this parameter is True, the function resets the window menu back to the default state.
The previous window menu, if any, is destroyed.

trans-unit.source: Returns If the $bRevert parameter is False, the return value is a handle to a copy of the window menu.

seg-source.mrk: Returns If the $bRevert parameter is False, the return value is a handle to a copy of the window menu.

target.mrk: Returns If the $bRevert parameter is False, the return value is a handle to a copy of the window menu.

trans-unit.source: If the $bRevert parameter is True, the return value is 0.

seg-source.mrk: If the $bRevert parameter is True, the return value is 0.

target.mrk: If the $bRevert parameter is True, the return value is 0.

trans-unit.source: Any window that does not use the GetSystemMenu function to make its own copy of the window menu receives the standard window menu.

seg-source.mrk: Any window that does not use the GetSystemMenu function to make its own copy of the window menu receives the standard window menu.

target.mrk: Any window that does not use the GetSystemMenu function to make its own copy of the window menu receives the standard window menu.

trans-unit.source: The window menu initially contains items with various identifier values, such as $SC_CLOSE, $SC_MOVE, and $SC_SIZE. Menu items on the window menu send $WM_SYSCOMMAND messages.

seg-source.mrk: The window menu initially contains items with various identifier values, such as $SC_CLOSE, $SC_MOVE, and $SC_SIZE.
Menu items on the window menu send $WM_SYSCOMMAND messages.

target.mrk: The window menu initially contains items with various identifier values, such as $SC_CLOSE, $SC_MOVE, and $SC_SIZE.
Menu items on the window menu send $WM_SYSCOMMAND messages.

trans-unit.source: All predefined window menu items have identifier numbers greater than 0xF000.

seg-source.mrk: All predefined window menu items have identifier numbers greater than 0xF000.

target.mrk: All predefined window menu items have identifier numbers greater than 0xF000.

trans-unit.source: If an application adds commands to the window menu, it should use identifier numbers less than 0xF000.

seg-source.mrk: If an application adds commands to the window menu, it should use identifier numbers less than 0xF000.

target.mrk: If an application adds commands to the window menu, it should use identifier numbers less than 0xF000.

trans-unit.source: The system automatically grays items on the standard window menu, depending on the situation.

seg-source.mrk: The system automatically grays items on the standard window menu, depending on the situation.

target.mrk: The system automatically grays items on the standard window menu, depending on the situation.

trans-unit.source: The application can perform its own checking or graying by responding to the $WM_INITMENU message that is sent before any menu is displayed.

seg-source.mrk: The application can perform its own checking or graying by responding to the $WM_INITMENU message that is sent before any menu is displayed.

target.mrk: The application can perform its own checking or graying by responding to the $WM_INITMENU message that is sent before any menu is displayed.

trans-unit.source: Write a line of text to Notepad

seg-source.mrk: Write a line of text to Notepad

target.mrk: Write a line of text to Notepad
